result.execSummary:
The defendant Christy L Scheiber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Ms. Scheiber  to 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years & 0 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years & 0 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay Court Appointed Attorney fees
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
 per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening; 1 time per month for first 3 months upon release from jail/prison; thereafter per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--provide Agent with written documentation from prescribing physician(s) of all prescribed medications
--take all prescribed medications a prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent; Ms. Scheiber may have contact with her husband at the discretion of the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 3:30pm [mo]
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas J Laitsch.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Ms. Scheiber  to  4  years in the Wisconsin State Prison System, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  0  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of   2 years & 0 months.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court gives  226   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening; 1 time per month for first 3 months upon release from jail/prison; thereafter per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--provide Agent with written documentation from prescribing physician(s) of all prescribed medications
--take all prescribed medications a prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent; Ms. Scheiber may have contact with her husband at the discretion of the Agent
--to pay Court Appointed Attorney fees
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Letter from Defendant requesting court appointed counsel
Attorney Laitsch

Case called at 9:04am [mo]
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court, in custody.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
[This case was Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today]
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance 
Upon questioning of the Court, Ms. Scheiber confirms Attorney Hunt will not be representing her on these charges.
Upon questioning of the Court, Ms. Scheiber indicates that previously she had been ineligible for PD representation, but that her circumstances have changed since then and that she may now be eligible for PD representation or Court appointed attorney. 
Ms. Scheiber indicates she sent a letter  explaining these issues on Thursday (4/30/15), along with a Petition for Court appointed counsel
recess: 9:08am---reconvene: 9:10am (to allow Clerk to locate letter sent from Ms. Scheiber)
The Court is presented with the letter from Ms. Scheiber along with the Petition for Court appointed counsel.
The Court directs Ms. Scheiber to apply for PD representation once again
Atty. Svehlek who is present in the courtroom gallery addresses the Court as to PD representation eligibility: the amount of the cash posted by Ms. Scheiber's husband is considered an asset, and this causes her not to qualify for PD representation 
The Court will review the Petition for appointment of counsel and then make a discussion as to qualification for Court appointed counsel
DA Happ questions the truthfullness of the Petition.
The Court questions Ms. Scheiber as to the truthfullness and her understanding of the Petition and current financial situation.
The Court gives oath to Ms. Scheiber as to truthfullness of Petition and further information she has given to the Court. 
The Court finds that Ms. Scheiber is currently indigent and appoints Attorney Thomas Laitsch to Ms. Scheiber's case.
The Court will set repayment amount at a later hearing. 
The Court's JA is to contact Attorney Laitsch to re-schedule a Preliminary Hearing. 
recess : 9:30am

NEXT: JA is to contact Attorney Laitsch to re-schedule a Preliminary Hearing
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
from Attorney Hunt advising the COurt that he has not been retained to represent the defendant on this case, and that he will not be appearing a the 5/4/15 Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 2:23pm.  Clerk - CRHI.  
Defendant Christy L Scheiber in court via video with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office for bond purposes only.  Defendant Christy L Scheiber in custody. DA Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon agree of the parties, the Court fines the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Atty. Zarwell indicates that the defendant has counsel on her other pending case. 
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing on 5/4/15 at 9am.

The Court requires a $25,000.00 CASH Bond, with conditions: 
-No possession of any needles or other drug paraphernalia unless it is for prescribed medications.
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Daily urinalyses at Jefferson County Jail at 6pm.
Recess 2:37pm

NEXT:   (Notices to be mailed.)
Preliminary Hearing on 5/4/15 at 9am.
